ul.li:
System requirements:
Ubuntu 18.04
A minimum of 10 GB of free disk space for the installer and more for tasks that will be created by the users
You cannot upgrade Content Fusion on the existing machine. It needs to be installed on a new machine and all tasks and configurations will be imported to the new machine during the upgrade process.
Custom frameworks and plugins will need to be reinstalled manually on the new machine.
The upgrade process will involve some downtime, so pick a time that does not affect the users.
To test the upgrade procedure, you need to have a task created on the old machine before starting the upgrade procedure.

ol.li: Deploy the new version of Content Fusion on a new machine according to the appropriate deployment method:
Once the new machine is ready, enable maintenance mode on the old machine. Maintenance mode is needed to ensure that users are not making any changes to the tasks while the backup is being created.

Create a backup of the old machine by running the following command on the old machine:sudo bash /fusion/admin/create-fusion-backup.shThis will create a backup archive fusion-backup.tar.gz in the current directory. If the backup file already exists, it will be overwritten.
Copy the fusion-backup.tar.gz backup file to the newly deployed machine.

On the newly deployed machine, run the following command to restore the backup:sudo bash /fusion/admin/restore-fusion-backup.sh /path/to/fusion-backup.tar.gz
Result: After restoring the backup, all the user tasks and configurations will be available in the new Content Fusion machine.This means that the admin password on the new machine will be the same as the admin password on the old machine.

Because the backup was created while maintenance mode was enabled, the new Content Fusion machine will be in maintenance mode after the backup restore. Go to the Administration Page and disable maintenance mode.
Manually reinstall any custom frameworks or plugins that you were using on the old machine.
To test the upgrade, check to make sure the tasks and configurations that were present on the old machine are now present on the new machine.
Replace the old machine with the new one.
